result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ollie Bernard Lashley

defendant.name: Lashley, Ollie Bernard

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ollie Bernard Lashley in court.  Attorney Robert E Webb Jr in court for Ollie Bernard Lashley.  Attorney Owen M Piotrawski for Daniel T Flaherty in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing. Attorney Daniel T Flaherty in trial in another court on another matter. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 36. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed.

Defendant Ollie Bernard Lashley in court.  Attorney Robert E Webb Jr in court for Ollie Bernard Lashley.  Attorney Daniel T Flaherty in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing. Parties are still in negotiating posture. For reasons stated on the record, parties request adjournment. Court grants request. All previously ordered conditions of bail remain. Case is adjourned to Br. 36.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9-22-2022

Attorney Robert E Webb in court.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a plea/sentencing.  Court waives defendant's appearance.  Parties request an adjournment as they are waiting for additional information.  Court rescheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-10-2022
Due to court availability case is rescheduled. Parties notified.

Defendant Ollie Bernard Lashley in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for plea and sentencing hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Ollie Bernard Lashley in court with Attorney Robert E Webb.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Signed and filed.

Defendant Ollie Bernard Lashley in court.  Samuel E. Simpson on behalf of Daniel Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Indigency hearing. Defendant did not appear, Court issued a bench warrant. Case recalled, defendant appears. Court vacated warrant. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court.  Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Attorney Robert Webb, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $25.00 per month beginning 6-1-2022, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned, Branch 38.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

01:45 PM Defendant Ollie Bernard Lashley in court in person.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant appears without counsel. Defendant is not eligible for SPD and has not retained counsel. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.   Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered no contact with Taco Bell located at 5441 N. Lovers Lane Rd., Milwaukee, WI.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Ollie Bernard Lashley in court with attorney Ruby de Leon.  Defendant Ollie Bernard Lashley in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
